note.p: Career: Entered the Camaldolese Order of monks (1687); Teacher of Mathematics at the order's house in Florence (1694); Professor of Philosophy, Pisa (1700); Mathematician to the Grand Duke of Tuscany (1707); Professor of Mathematics, Pisa (1714)
References: A Rupert Hall, 'Further Newton Correspondence' in NR 1982-83 vol 37 pp 7-34
Authority: DSB is the source of the precise death dates (index to BR gives only the years).
